reviews.text: I was looking for decent, affordable accomodations in Venice convenient to St. Mark's Square and the Doni satisfied all my needs. Though you do have to leave your key at the front desk, I often struck up a conversation with the friendly staff, and since I was alone for two days before my friends met me there, it was very nice to feel included. Breakfast is light (rolls and coffee), but it was enough for me to get started for the day, since I prefer to eat outside the hotel to better experience the local cuisine. It's not easy to find the hotel, though I suppose nothing in Venice is, but by the end of my stay, I had discovered several different ways to get back to the Doni. I also didn't mind getting lost in Venice, since it's often brought me to places only locals or other lost souls had discovered.
reviews.title: So Close to St. Mark's!

likes.liked: — Close Proximity to St. Mark's Square.

reviews.title: Best Apt.ever
reviews.text: While Hotel Doni was unable to accommodate us for the required dates Nickos suggested an Apt. imin from the hotel. Such luxury. It was completely refurbished and could accommodate 6 people. Fully equiped and overlooked one of the main canals for the Gondolas. We sat in our window and listened to them every evening. We were 1 min. from St. Marks Sq. in the heart of throbbing Venice. Every day maid service. We have never experienced suc h luxury at such an affordable price. Highly recommend.
Mary & Tom Rose , California
reviews.title: warm and inviting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Doni. The rooms were quite comfortable and quite attractive. The location was perfect behind Piazza San Marco and easy to find. Would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Very charming, in the heart of Venice

likes.disliked: — The breakfast was only basic - but as a buffet

reviews.text: I just returned from a wonderful vacation in the ancient Venice.
reviews.title: Cheap but not worth it...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This small hotel was better than expected. We're told that most rooms are very small but our room (#8) was huge with terrazzo floor, frescoed ceiling and glass chandelier. It knocked us over when we opened the door. The building is a 17th century 'palace' and, like everything in Venice, it shows its age but you'll find it very clean. The washroom was small but clean and everything worked fine. Location was super with St Marks, good restaurants, vaparretto station, ect. just a short walk away. The host and his staff were very nice and always helpful. All and all, a good value and a pleasant experience that exceeded our expectations. We would return if ever back in Venice.
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

likes.liked: — The ambiance of a small, old hotel on a backstreet in Venice.

reviews.title: Good Hotel - Great location
reviews.text: We stayed at the Albergo Doni for three nights in May of 2007.
It's a one star hotel and it looks it. The floors creak, the doors are crooked and the rooms are a bit run-down.
reviews.title: Loved the location

reviews.text: Our room was on the second floor at the back of the Hotel. The room was immense. They would normally put 4 people in there but they gave it to us as a double. The ceiling had to be 4-5 metres (12-15 ft) high and it was adorned by a Fresco and a Murano glass chandelier. All of which could have used a bit of cleaning and/or painting. The en-suite bathroom had been added as a box with an 8 foot ceiling to a corner of the room. It was very modern, clean and fully functional.
reviews.title: Vampire hunting!!!
Hotel hostesses were wonderful!
reviews.text: Our room looked over a restaurant terrace and it was a bit noisy until 11:00 pm when the place closed up.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our recent Italian vacation which included hotel stays in Rome, Florence and Venice was topped off with a wonderful stay at a flat belonging to the hotel Albergo DONI in Venice. The flat was very roomy, had clean Italian decorated cement floors and was located on the second floor – all of the normal hotel rooms were full during our mid April visit. The flat was a nice change of pace from the normally cramped European hotel rooms. The flat was conveniently located only a couple of minutes walk form San Marco Plaza and very quiet. It was amazing how quickly you could remove yourself from the daily influx of crowded tourist sights and have some privacy and the amenities of home. Mid April was unusually warm and did not warrant anything more than a light jacket.
reviews.title: Alan and Susan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We certainly got the better deal as Abergo DONI was the least expensive, per night stay, of all our Italian hotels. Breakfast was not included but this was a minor detail as delis, cappuccino bars, patio restaurants, internet center and even a pharmacy were conveniently located just outside of the flat’s exterior door. For us it was a total immersion into the Italian lifestyle.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great room
Great location, great price
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay immensely - this hotel is definitely worth returning to!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Alan and Susan, California
reviews.title: Perfect, Affordable Stay with a View- and the requisite crazy Italian owner

likes.disliked: — Occasionaly street noise, lackluster prepackaged breakfast (tho standard for Italy)

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Albergo Doni for two nights and were very happy. We had a room over the canal as well. Older building, some peeling wallpaper and other rough-around-the-edges bits, but good furniture, romantic "feel," and helpful, friendly staff. It was exactly what we had wanted -- why go to an old city like Venice and stay in something that resembles a U.S. chain hotel?
reviews.title: Good location
Couldn't have found a better place!!!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Doni's for three days in June and really liked it a lot! First of all because it's located in the very heart of Venice. It's only a three minutes walk to the St Marcus Square, and also the vaporetto stop San Zaccaria is very close, so getting to the hotel and back to the airport was very easy even with the big and heavy luggage we had.

reviews.title: The worst breakfast we have ever been offered!
reviews.text: From our nice and spacious antique Venetian-style bedroom we had a fantastic view over a romantic canal, where you could even see pass the gondolas, which was especially nice in the evening when the gondoliere would sing their serenades.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean as was the shared toilet/bathroom which was located on the same floor and available whenever we needed it.
reviews.title: For the price, you can't beat Albergo Doni

reviews.text: The breakfast was typical Italian, that is quite simple, but you could eat as much as you liked from the buffet and the coffee was the tipical strong Italian expresso - very delicious!!! So for the price we paid we couldn't have desired more.
reviews.title: Great Location, A few trade-offs though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was always very friendly, they all spoke good English and were always available, providing us with useful information.
reviews.title: A bit of a disappointment
